channel.title: Comments on: How To Have A Reliable Serve Toss In Tennis
channel.description: Your secret weapon on the court.

item.title: By: Maire
item.dc:creator: Maire
item.description: Hi your advice on the toss is brilliant. Im mortified at the moment as my toss is so bad. Double after double I release too early, bend my arm and move my hand/fingers. Im slapping down on low tosses that are way off to the right, im almost on the next court I have to reach so far. Its heartbreaking. Im trying to keep my arm up after release but Im confused over where my weight hip/foot should be??? Im just back after 3 months of TE caused by serve. Btw on occassions I do hit really good serves when the ball is nice and high and in my zone. Sorry to bother you with all of the above Many thanks Maire (desperate) Ireland

item.title: By: mark johnson
item.dc:creator: mark johnson
item.description: That was one of the best serve toss instruction I have ever seen ! Very helpful to me ! I am getting back into tennis after about a 30 year layoff. Iam 66, and I play against my 33 year old son. He is 6'3, 215 former hockey player, and a great athlete. He has been beating up on me pretty badly, but I'm going to kick his ass now !! Thank you for doing this !

item.title: By: Jenny Avis
item.dc:creator: Jenny Avis
item.description: Your advice seems great. I can't "feel" the ball in my left hand. I used to be a professional player with a reasonable serve, now I just cannot toss the ball, it's in my "head". Please help. thank you, Jenny
